summary: Implemented the frontend build version bump to v33 and added an admin-facing Caffeine deploy UI notice to the Admin Panel. However, the diff cannot evidence that a build+deploy was executed or that the deploy output included (or still lacked) the Publish URL/Open App link, and the notice text does not clearly state the “pause and retry later” plan requested.

missing_requirements.requirement: Run a new build+deploy after the version bump and record whether Caffeine shows a Publish URL / “Open App” link (or capture the missing-URL outcome/error for follow-up).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows BUILD_VERSION was bumped, but there is no verifiable evidence in the provided file changes that an actual build+deploy was executed, nor any recorded deploy output/outcome as required by the acceptance criteria.

missing_requirements.requirement: Admin Panel notice should explain that if Publish URL / “Open App” is missing after a successful deploy, it’s a platform issue and the team will pause and retry later.
missing_requirements.reason: A notice was added, but its copy focuses on refreshing/switching tabs and states it’s a platform UI issue; it does not clearly communicate the requested “pause and retry later” plan.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a release notes template file with sections unrelated to this deploy-retry request (e.g., V40+ backend cleanup / HOTEL DUMMY purge content).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest is scoped to a deploy retry/release bump and an Admin Panel notice, and explicitly says not to change backend logic; adding extensive release note templates referencing backend cleanup is not requested by the requirements.

hallucinated_features.description: Updated/added project tracking metadata (project_state.json) including references to out-of-scope admin delete-room feature and other state fields.
hallucinated_features.reason: Project-state tracking files were not requested by REQ-1 or REQ-2 and are outside the stated deploy retry + UI notice scope.
This file change is not part of the requested requirements (version bump + admin notice) and appears to be ancillary documentation.
